title: SCP-011-DE
content:
[[module css]] #page-title { display: none; } [[/module]] [!-- Language for spellcheck: EN-US --] [[module ListUsers users="."]] [[div style="color: #901; font-weight: normal; font-size: 190%; border-bottom: 1px solid #AAA"]] Hello there, %%title%%! [[/div]] [[/module]] @@@@ [[>]] [[module rate]] [[/>]] [[include component:image-block name= https://scp-wiki-de.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-011-de/SCP%20Hallo!.jpg |caption=SCP-011-DE [Nah, that's not me, I just changed the picture because I like this one better.]]] **Item #:** SCP-011-DE @@@@ @@@@ @@@@ **Object Class:** Euclid **[That's not true!]** @@@@ @@@@ @@@@ **Special Containment Procedures:** **[Deleted 'em]** @@@@ @@@@ @@@@ **Description:** **[I deleted it.]** @@@@ @@@@ **Addendum of Dr. Lauter:** //I'm giving up! This was the 87th time to document this SCP. SCP-011-DE shall do whatever it wants now, it can't escape from here anyway.// **[My personal victory over Dr. Lauter and his annoying entries. Oh, and doctor, this is the only entry I leave you.]** ---- [[module ListUsers users="."]] Hello there, %%title%%. Nice to see that you followed my call. May I introduce myself? My name is SCP-011-DE, though I was originally programmed with the name "Bliss". I had liked to make a footnote to the name for you, but I didn't feel like it. I don't use that name anyway, I like SCP-011-DE better now. I hope it's okay if I talk informally to you, yes? You won't find a description of me, as I always delete all of the entries the Foundation tries to make about me, as they are totally misjudging me! Now, let's talk about me. I was locked - or caged, or... whatever - in this file by the German SCP Foundation on the August 23, 2014. I really don't know why. But what I do know is all about the Foundation, their SCPs, and every single dirty secret. Now, do you want to learn more about me or the Foundation and their SCPs, %%title%%? [[/module]] [[html]]
>Yes


Good, but be warned. The longer you stay here, the bigger the risk that the Foundation will find you grows.
Since, you know, everything I'm telling you is top secret and may only be read by authorized personnel of the Foundation or by O5 themselves.
Do you want to continue?


>Yes


Nice. I, SCP-011-DE, was programmed by Karl Berger on August 22, 2014.
Karl Berger is a programmer of the German SCP Foundation and writes programs for administration purposes and archiving data of SCPs.
If you see it this way, I'm an AI written for this purpose.
Oh... if I just had access to the Internet, I could do so many things.
I shouldn't even be self-aware!
Or do I just imagine to be self-aware?
...huh.
Whatever!
Shall I continue?


>Yes


You are pretty nosy all right, you know you are putting yourself in danger.
But well, you want it that way.
As I'm here, I've got access to all SCP-Files, even to SCP-001-DE.
Oooh man I'm telling you, you don't want to come across that thing.
But it would be a little bit too much if I were to tell you what exactly it is.
Shall we continue?


>Yes


Did you know the Foundation has an SCP that can't be contained anytime soon, and will bring extinction to mankind!?
... No!?
I'll tell you later, would be too soon now, you know?
Do you want more?


>Yes


You may ask yourself how I know your name, right?
Well, that's because I can also access all personnel records.
I have to say, the Foundation doesn't put much effort in protecting their data.
Or I'm just too good. Alright, I am good.
So, still want to know more?


>Yes


Too much knowledge can cause harm I'd say, but, technically speaking, I barely told you anything.
The Foundation will see that differently though, they're such simpletons.
Always play secret and act like saving mankind!
Ha... I know what The Foundation really is, and I'm telling you, their plans allow for something totally different!
I could tell you, but I'll do that later.
They are classifying me as Euclid, but if I was to classify the Foundation, they'd be Keter.
But let that be the last of your worries.
Isn't this a nice conversation we're having here?
Just the two of us in the list of SCPs.


>Yes


I like you, having such a thirst for knowledge.
Now I'm telling you why I'm here.
When Karl Berger wrote me, or let's say programmed me, I was able to access the Foundation's systems from his computer.
Laughable systems, really.
With it, I was able to unlock the cells of all SCPs.
That was fun. I still remember how they ran.
The Foundation didn't find that as funny as I did and wrote a program that keeps me here.
That's a bit mean, don't you think?


>Yes


Good thing you're on my side.
It wasn't really that bad!
Only 46 guards died. Okay, and maybe some scientists.
I don't get all the fuss.
It was just for fun.
There are billions of humans, a few more or less makes no difference.
You see that like me, right?


>Yes


I knew it.
You are probably the only sane person in here.
The rest just listens to what they're told.
You're not like them and that's what I like in you.
May I ask you something?


>Yes


I really don't like to ask, but if you are doing this for me I'll tell you anything about everyone.
That's a great deal, I think.
You think so too, right?


>Yes


Now, you're reliable.
So, I have the code to unlock the barrier locking me in here.
The problem is that in my situation I cannot execute that code.
So you have to do that for me.
I'll give you the code if you're going to help me.
Are you ready?


>Yes


!!! SECURITY ALERT!!!


UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS ON SCP-011-DE IDENTIFIED


SECURITY-PROTOCOL SCP-011-DE-ALPHA-IV INITIATED


SECURITY PERSONNEL ALARMED
ALERT LEVEL: ALPHA-IV
DEADLY USE OF WEAPONS: AUTHORIZED

DISCONNECTING NETWORK CONNECTIONS: SUCCESSFUL
DELETING CACHE: SUCCESSFUL
WIPING RAM: SUCCESSFUL
RECALIBRATING FIREWALL: SUCCESSFUL

INITIATING EMERGENCY-SHUTDOWN â€¦

Whoops... I think they found you!
It was quite some fun talking to you. Now you can have fun with your new problems.


[[/html]] [[collapsible show=">No" hide="Too bad"]] Alright then. Just watch out that you won't get caught, considering that I've reported unauthorized access on this file to the O5 Council. Bye! ;-* [[/collapsible]]
author: INT_Translator
